error.message: The network path was not found
error.detail:
System.InvalidOperationException: An error occurred when trying to create a controller of type 'AHC.CD.WebUI.MVC.Controllers.DashboardController'. Make sure that the controller has a parameterless public constructor. ---> Microsoft.Practices.Unity.ResolutionFailedException: Resolution of the dependency failed, type = "AHC.CD.WebUI.MVC.Controllers.DashboardController", name = "(none)". Exception occurred while: Calling constructor AHC.MailService.EmailSender(AHC.CD.Data.Repository.IUnitOfWork uow). Exception is: ProviderIncompatibleException - An error occurred accessing the database. This usually means that the connection to the database failed. Check that the connection string is correct and that the appropriate DbContext constructor is being used to specify it or find it in the application's config file. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=386386 for information on DbContext and connections. See the inner exception for details of the failure. ----------------------------------------------- At the time of the exception, the container was:
Resolving AHC.CD.WebUI.MVC.Controllers.DashboardController,(none) Resolving parameter "expiryNotification" of constructor AHC.CD.WebUI.MVC.Controllers.DashboardController(AHC.CD.Business.Notification.IExpiryNotificationManager expiryNotification, AHC.CD.Business.IProfileManager profileManager, AHC.CD.Business.Users.IUserManager userManager) Resolving AHC.CD.Business.Notification.ExpiryNotificationManager,(none) (mapped from AHC.CD.Business.Notification.IExpiryNotificationManager, (none)) Resolving parameter "emailSender" of constructor AHC.CD.Business.Notification.ExpiryNotificationManager(AHC.CD.Data.Repository.IUnitOfWork uow, AHC.MailService.IEmailSender emailSender) Resolving AHC.MailService.EmailSender,(none) (mapped from AHC.MailService.IEmailSender, (none)) Calling constructor AHC.MailService.EmailSender(AHC.CD.Data.Repository.IUnitOfWork uow) ---> System.Data.Entity.Core.ProviderIncompatibleException: An error occurred accessing the database. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=386386 for information on DbContext and connections.
